meanings.definition: Four times as great or as numerous.
meanings.sent1: The cake was a fourfold delight with four layers of chocolate goodness.
meanings.sent2: She received a fourfold increase in her allowance, now getting four times the amount she used to.
meanings.sent3: The fourfold number of balloons made the party decorations look extravagant.
meanings.sent4: His fourfold dedication to his studies paid off with straight A's.
meanings.sent5: The fourfold beauty of the sunset took her breath away.

meanings.definition: Four times as much or as many.
meanings.sent1: The fourfold amount of candy in the jar made the kids' eyes light up.
meanings.sent2: He needed a fourfold increase in his savings to afford the new car.
meanings.sent3: The fourfold number of birds in the tree created a chirping symphony.
meanings.sent4: Her fourfold collection of stamps filled up three albums.
meanings.sent5: The fourfold joy of having all her friends together was priceless.

meanings.sent1: She decided to fourfold her recipe to make enough cookies for everyone.
meanings.sent2: He planned to fourfold his investment in the stock market.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to fourfold the number of rabbits in his hat but failed.
meanings.sent4: The rumor about the treasure hunt fourfolded in size as it spread through the town.
meanings.sent5: The population of the town would fourfold if everyone decided to move there.
